availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph F. Blythe (Ghent, Carroll County, Kentucky, resident and Private, Union Army, 32nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry.)

body.p: Ghent, Carroll County, Kentucky, resident and Private, Union Army, 32nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry. Kentucky, native. Son of William D. Blythe and Amanda M. Blythe. Attending school in 1860 and served in 32nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry, U.S.A., as a Private.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Ghent, p. 2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Jackson County, Ward (1) Seymour, p. 3.
